overall.description: Compute the one-dimensional inverse discrete Fourier Transform.

n.description: Length of the transformed axis of the output. If n is smaller than the length of the input, the input is cropped. If it is larger, the input is padded with zeros.  If n is not given, the length of the input along the axis specified by axis is used. See notes about padding issues.

axis.description: Axis over which to compute the inverse DFT.  If not given, the last axis is used.

norm.description: New in version 1.10.0.  Normalization mode (see numpy.fft). Default is None.

out.description: The truncated or zero-padded input, transformed along the axis indicated by axis, or the last one if axis is not specified.
